questions.question_text: Which TWO statements about the Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI) File Storage Service are accurate? (Choose two.)

choices.E: Customer can encrypt the communication to a mount target via export options.
choices.A: File systems use Oracle-managed keys by default.
choices.C: Mount targets use Oracle-managed keys by default.
choices.B: Customer can encrypt data in their file system using their own Vault encryption key.
choices.D: Communication with file systems in a mount target is encrypted via HTTPS.

choices.C: Create an instance principal for the DB System. Write an Identity and Access Management (IAM) policy that allows the instance principal read-only access to the file storage service.
choices.A: Create an NFS export option that allows READ_ONLY access where the source is the CIDR range of the DB System subnet.
choices.D: Modify the security list associated with the subnet where the mount target resides. Change the ingress rules corresponding to the DB System subnet to be stateful.
choices.B: Modify the security list associated with the subnet where the mount target resides. Change the ingress rules corresponding to the DB System subnet to be stateless.

questions.question_text:
You created a virtual cloud network (VCN) with three private subnets. Two of the subnets contain application servers and the third subnet contains a DB System. The application requires a shared file system, therefore you have provisioned one using the file storage service (FSS).
You have also created the corresponding mount target in one of the application subnets. The VCN security lists are properly configured so that the application servers can access FSS. The security team changed the settings for the DB System to have read-only access to the file system. However, when they test it, they are unable to access FSS.
How would you allow access to FSS?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
NFS Export Options: These control access to the file system at the NFS protocol level. You can specify which subnets or IP ranges can access the file system and what level of access (read, write) they have.
By creating an NFS export option that grants read-only access to the specific CIDR range of the DB System subnet, you explicitly allow the DB System to access the FSS with the necessary permissions.

Selected Answer: A
NFS export options define access permissions for NFS clients accessing the file system. By creating an NFS export option with READ_ONLY access, you restrict the DB System to read-only access.
You specify the source of access in the export option, which in this case would be the CIDR range of the DB System subnet. This ensures that only resources within the DB System subnet can access the file system.
Configuring the NFS export option in this manner ensures that the DB System has the necessary permissions to access the file system for its read-only operations.

Selected Answer: D
Should be D.

questions.question_text: Which Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI) Identity and Access Management (IAM) policy is invalid?

choices.C: Allow any-user to inspect users in tenancy
choices.B: Allow group A-Admins to manage all-resources in compartment Project-A
choices.D: Allow dynamic-group FrontEnd to manage instance-family in compartment Project-A
choices.A: Allow group A-Developers to create volumes in compartment Project-A

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
"create" is not a valid verb. Correct answer is A

https://docs.oracle.com/en-us/iaas/Content/Identity/policyreference/policyreference_topic-Verbs.htm
Valid verbs are inspect, read, use and manage â€” "create" is not a valid verb. Answer is A.

Selected Answer: A
allow group A-Developers to manage volumes in compartment Project-A
https://docs.public.oneportal.content.oci.oraclecloud.com/en-us/iaas/Content/Identity/Concepts/commonpolicies.htm#volume-admins-manage-volumes-and-backups

A. Allow group A-Developers to create volumes in compartment Project-A
This is correct one

I think the ivalid is:
Allow group A-Developers to create volumes in compartment Project-A, because create doen't exist

choices.B: Only a file system that has been exported can be used as a target file system.
choices.C: You can replicate the data in one file system to another file system in the same region or a different region.
choices.A: You cannot specify a replication interval when you create the replication resource.
choices.D: You can replicate the data in one file system to another file system only in the same region.

questions.question_text: Which statement is true about File System Replication in Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI)?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
File System Replication in OCI allows you to replicate data from one file system to another, providing redundancy and disaster recovery capabilities.
You can replicate data within the same region or across different regions, allowing for cross-region redundancy and disaster recovery solutions.
This feature enables you to maintain copies of your data in multiple locations, improving data availability and resilience to regional failures.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is a valid RFC 1918 CIDR prefix that can be used for creating an Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI) Virtual Cloud Network (VCN)?

discussion.content: VCN Size range must be between /30 and /16. Only A and B fulfill this. And in B there is an illegal 268 for a subnet...
read the question carefully, Answer is only A
10.0.0.0/8 Class A this is correct, but in OCI is valid only when start with /16, example 10.0.0.0/16

comments.content: 10.0.0.0/8 cannot be used as a VCN range, because "The allowable VCN size range is /16 to /30. Example: 10.0.0.0/16." Source: https://docs.oracle.com/en-us/iaas/Content/Network/Concepts/overview.htm

discussion.content:
Correct answer A,C,D
The RFC 1918 prefixes are:
10.0.0.0/8 Class A
172.16.0.0/12 Class B
192.168.0.0/16 Class C
